amalgamation

noun
combination of companies into one
7.5 0.75/m
Pronunciation: / É™ËŒmÃ¦l.É¡É™ËˆmeÉª.ÊƒÉ™n /; / É™ËŒmÃ¦lÉ¡É™ËˆmeÉªÊƒÉ™n / (AmE), / É™ËŒmal.É¡É™ËˆmeÉª.ÊƒÉ™n /; / É™ËŒmÃ¦lÉ¡É™ËˆmeÉªÊƒÉ™n / (BrE)
the process of combining two or more things (such as companies, schools, or other entities) into one

Examples

The amalgamation of companies
After a lengthy negotiation, the amalgamation was finally approved by both companies' boards.
Industry experts analyzed the effects of the recent amalgamation on consumer choice and pricing.
The amalgamation of the two banks created one of the largest financial institutions in the country.
The amalgamation of the two schools created a larger and more diverse student body.
Cultural amalgamation can lead to new traditions and shared values in a community.
The amalgamation of different musical styles resulted in a unique sound.

Synonyms

  • merger
    3.9 9.19/m
    a merger joins two or more companies into one legal firm, while an amalgamation can mean any combining of entities.
  • consolidation
    5.5 5.25/m
    consolidation makes separate parts stronger and more efficient as one unit, while an amalgamation simply combines entities.
  • unification
    4.3 4.51/m
    unification brings groups together to form a single unit, often for policy reasons, while an amalgamation is general combining.
  • incorporation
    4.9 4.73/m
    incorporation often means forming a legal company or including parts formally, while an amalgamation is broader combining of entities.
  • coalescence
    7.8 0.28/m
    coalescence describes different elements slowly coming together into one whole, while an amalgamation often implies a planned combination.
  • fusion
    4.1 4.05/m
    fusion blends parts closely to make something new or mixed, while an amalgamation means joining entities into a single body.
  • uniting
    3.5 0.30/m
    uniting is the act of bringing people or things together informally, while an amalgamation often refers to formal organizational combining.

Related Terms

  • synonym: combination - the act of joining or mixing together
  • synonym: merger - the joining together of two or more companies, organizations, or businesses into one
  • antonym: separation - the act of moving things apart or keeping them apart
